body_html:
I agree with you that it would be great to have support for zero dimensions, but I'm not sure how much work that would involve.
We have solved this problem with torch.cat by manually handling empty tensors, but properly handling zero dimensions would maybe be better.

About tensors with no dimensions, we are introducing scalars in pytorch, which is similar to numpy. You can find a very nice discussion about it in #1433 (comment).

body:
I agree with you that it would be great to have support for zero dimensions, but I'm not sure how much work that would involve.
We have solved this problem with `torch.cat` by manually handling empty tensors, but properly handling zero dimensions would maybe be better.

About tensors with no dimensions, we are introducing scalars in pytorch, which is similar to numpy. You can find a very nice discussion about it in https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/1433#issuecomment-329907197.
